title: Partitive Case Basics
content:
The partitive case is unique to Finnish. It is used for:
1. Numbers (except 1) -> kaksi autoa (two cars)
2. Uncountable nouns -> minä juon kahvia (I drink coffee)
3. Negative sentences -> minulla ei ole autoa (I don't have a car)

**Ending:**
Usually -a / -ä or -ta / -tä.

exercises.question: Why use partitive in 'Minä juon vettä' (I drink water)?
